messages.content: What are your office hours?
We're open Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. We're closed on Saturdays and Sundays.
When are you open?
We're open Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. We're closed on weekends.
Are you open on weekends?
No, we're closed on Saturdays and Sundays. We're open Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.
What insurance do you accept?
We accept most major insurance plans including Medicare, Medicaid, Blue Cross Blue Shield, Aetna, Cigna, and United Healthcare. Please call us to verify your specific plan.
Do you take my insurance?
We accept most major insurance plans. Please call us at (555) 123-4567 to verify your specific plan coverage.
How do I schedule an appointment?
To schedule an appointment, please call us at (555) 123-4567. Our staff will help you find a convenient time that works for you.
Can I book an appointment online?
Currently, we schedule appointments by phone. Please call us at (555) 123-4567 and we'll be happy to help you.
What's your phone number?
You can reach us at (555) 123-4567. We're available to take calls Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.
Where is your clinic located?
We're located at 123 Main Street in downtown. There's free parking available on site for patients.
Do I need a referral?
Many insurance plans require a referral for pain management services. Please check with your insurance provider or call us at (555) 123-4567 to verify.
What services do you offer?
We specialize in pain management including injections, nerve blocks, physical therapy, and medication management for chronic pain conditions.
Who are the doctors?
Our team includes board-certified pain management physicians Dr. Michael Chen, Dr. Sarah Martinez, and Dr. James Wilson, along with experienced nurse practitioners.
Do I need to fast before my appointment?
For most consultations, fasting isn't required. However, if you're scheduled for a procedure involving sedation, we'll provide specific pre-procedure instructions when you book your appointment.
Can I reschedule my appointment?
Yes, you can reschedule by calling us at (555) 123-4567. We ask that you provide at least 24 hours notice when possible.
What should I bring to my first appointment?
Please bring your photo ID, insurance card, list of current medications, and any relevant medical records or imaging results. Plan to arrive 15 minutes early to complete paperwork.
